intro: Thlaspi lilacinum, commonly known as the blue spring cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers are small, bright blue or violet, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Thlaspi lilacinum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
